subject: Learning
title: What Actually Differs Between Learners
description: A 60-second lesson on What Actually Differs Between Learners.

hook.text: If learning styles aren't real, why do students perform so differently in the same classroom?

buildup.text: The real differences are prior knowledge, working memory capacity, and motivationâ€”not sensory style.

discovery.text: A student with strong background knowledge outperforms peers regardless of instruction method.

twist.text: Working memory varies hugely between people. It limits how much new info you can process at once.

climax.text: Address these real differences and achievement gaps shrink. Chase styles and they don't.

punchline.text: Know what students know. Not how they 'prefer' to learn.

quiz.question: What truly differs between learners that impacts performance?
options: Prior knowledge, working memory, and motivation
Sensory preference for visual vs auditory input
Whether they are left-brained or right-brained
